channel.title: CNN.com - Entertainment
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - Entertainment
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Beyoncé No. 1 on Forbes list
item.description: Taylor Swift may be breaking records in the music industry, but Beyoncé is breaking the bank.

item.title: Wayne Brady reveals depression battle
item.description: In front of the camera, Wayne Brady is known for making people laugh. But behind the camera, the comedic talent has been struggling with depression.

item.title: Amanda Bynes' Twitter confusion
item.description: Actress Amanda Bynes says she's been diagnosed as bipolar and manic depressive and is on medication.

item.title: Kid meltdown in classic Kimmel prank
item.description: ABC's Jimmy Kimmel asked parents to tell their children that they ate all of their Halloween candy.

item.title: Christian Bale won't play Steve Jobs
item.description: Scratch Christian Bale off the list of actors supposed to play Steve Jobs.

item.title: Paisley's 'Black-ish' joke at CMAs divides
item.description: Brad Paisley has never shied away from controversial topics in his music: Alcohol helps white people dance. Celebrities can act like fools because people think they're cool. Real guys don't get "manicured, waxed and botoxed."

item.title: AC/DC drummer charged
item.description: Phil Rudd, the drummer for legendary hard rock band AC/DC, has been charged with attempting to have two men killed.

item.title: TV winners and losers
Robert Downey Jr. is a new dad
Vanilla Ice helps with baby announcement
item.description: A couple in Florida wanted to create a memorable baby announcement. CNN affiliate WPBF reports.

item.title: Dr. Phil McGraw vs. Punxatawney Dr. Phil
item.description: The mustachioed Texan, Dr. Phil, meets the show's resident bald rodent, Punxatawney Dr, Phil, and the sparks fly.

item.title: Swift says goodbye to Spotify
item.description: Taylor Swift says "bye" to Spotify, Tom Hanks to write book of short stories, and The Divine Miss M hits the road!

item.title: Rose McGowan apologizes to gay community
item.description: "Charmed" actress Rose McGowan has a bone to pick with gay activists -- but first, she has an apology to make.

item.title: 2014 CMA Awards: Red carpet
Taylor Swift's '1989' has huge sales week
item.description: It's official. Taylor Swift's new album has had the largest sales week since 2002, according to Billboard.

item.title: And the world's catchiest song is ...
item.description: If you really wanna get a song stuck in your head, you gotta get with my friends the Spice Girls. The group's 1996 debut single "Wannabe" is the world's catchiest song, researchers in Holland say.

item.title: Sophia Loren's classic side eye
item.description: It's a famous photograph: Sophia Loren, seated at a table, looking with side-eyed concern at Jayne Mansfield's breasts, which threaten to spill out of her low-cut dress.

item.title: Benedict Cumberbatch goes old-school with engagement
item.description: If you're going to break hearts, at least be classy about it.

item.title: A young Lorde covers Kings of Leon
item.description: Before she was a platinum-selling artist and Grammy winner, Lorde was a Kings of Leon fan.

item.title: Chris Botti's national anthem brings tears
item.description: Chris Botti's performance of the national anthem during "Monday Night Football" was so affecting it left viewers with chills, and one football in tears.

item.title: Chris Brown goes off (yes, again)
item.description: Chris Brown doesn't take kindly to you talking trash about his girlfriend.

item.title: 'New' Beyonce album isn't what you think
item.description: That "new, secret" Beyonce album everyone has been buzzing about is actually a "Beyonce Platinum Edition Box Set."

item.title: Taylor Swift set to smash records
item.description: It's Taylor Swift to the rescue. The superstar singer's "1989" album is forecast to sell more than 1.3 million copies through November 2, according to The Hollywood Reporter.

item.title: She's back! Rihanna rejoins Instagram
item.description: After a controversy over topless photos in May, Rihanna's Instagram feed went quiet for months.

item.title: Funny or Die: Madden's hilarious bugs
item.description: The wait is over -- it's officially football season. For more go to funnyordie.com.

item.title: Beyonce and Jay-Z heading for divorce?
item.description: The rumors about Beyonce and Jay-Z are getting crazier every day. For more go to funnyordie.com.

item.title: 'Mad Men' vixen takes on a modern office
item.description: "Mad Men" character Joan Holloway visits a more modern office. For more go to funnyordie.com.

item.title: Grumpy Cat takes on Christmas
item.description: What can be more in the Christmas spirit than Grumpy Cat? The feline is now star of a TV movie.

item.title: Chris Rock and Prince deliver on 'SNL'
item.description: Comedian Chris Rock delivered on his reputation for controversy as host of "Saturday Night Live" this weekend, but musical guest Prince is the one soaking up accolades the morning after for making history.

item.title: Oh, the horror? It's on the small screen
item.description: With all the scary stuff happening in the world, it wouldn't be surprising if TV audiences steered clear of horror. But in fact, they're doing the opposite.

item.title: Neil Patrick Harris may host variety show
item.description: Ladies and gentlemen, it's "The Neil Patrick Harris Show"! The performer will likely be hosting an NBC variety show, New York magazine reports.

item.title: 'House of Cards' actress dies
item.description: It's a sad time for the cast and crew of "House of Cards."

item.title: Another 'Bachelor' couple bites the dust
item.description: "The Bachelor's" latest match, Juan Pablo Galavis and Nikki Ferrell, have reportedly called it quits.

item.title: New 'Minions' trailer is here!
item.description: Minions fans rejoice. Those irrepressible, bespectacled yellow sidekicks who stole our hearts and tickled our funny bones in the "Despicable Me" movies are finally getting their own flick.

item.title: Dornan says no full frontal in '50 Shades'
item.description: We hate to break it to you, but if you are planning on seeing "50 Shades of Grey" so you can see a lot more of star Jamie Dornan, don't hold your breath.

item.title: Lupita Nyong'o doesn't know to be a celeb
item.description: Lupita Nyong'o is one of Glamour magazine's Women of the Year.

item.title: 'Nightcrawler,' 'Ouija' duke it out
item.description: Jake Gyllenhaal thriller "Nightcrawler" is positioned to be the lowest-grossing #1 debut in two years.

item.title: 'Furious 7' trailer is out
item.description: Universal Pictures debuts trailer for "Furious 7," the next installment in "Fast and Furious" franchise.

item.title: Who else is in for 'Age of Ultron' movie?
item.description: The cast for Marvel's "Avengers: Age of Ultron" just keeps getting better.

item.title: So many 'Frozen' dresses sold
item.description: Disney is reporting that sales of dresses based on its megahit movie "Frozen" topped 3 million in North America this year alone.

item.title: Beyoncé no. 1 on Forbes top-earning list
item.description: Taylor Swift may be breaking records in the music industry, but Beyoncé is breaking the bank.

item.title: Martin Short stays sunny-side up
item.description: Conan O'Brien has called Martin Short the "funniest guy ever," but, at times, Short's sunny outlook has come at the expense of great loss.

item.title: 'C-3PO': New 'Star Wars' best yet
item.description: Them's fightin' words, Anthony Daniels. C-3PO of "Star Wars" says new film will be best sequel ever.

item.title: Lil Jon makes cross-country flight to vote
item.description: What's your excuse for not voting today? You moved and forgot to change your address? Can't get out of work on time? You don't care about the issues?

item.title: Amanda Bynes' Twitter confusion
item.description: Actress Amanda Bynes says she's been diagnosed as bipolar and manic depressive and is on medication.

item.title: Happy birthday, Matthew McConaughey
What's streaming in November
item.description: Netflix, Hulu and iTunes are adding titles to their streaming options in November.

item.title: First a movie, now to TV
Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Martin split
Quelle surprise! Bilingual stars
item.description: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg already owns a good chunk of the Internet, but on Wednesday he won it as well when he spoke Chinese to an audience at a Beijing university.

item.title: Baby bump alert: See who's expecting
